item.description:
UDPATE: Snow may cause a cancellation. To find out if it's been cancelled: Check ctweather.com, or wtnh.com, or call Neighborhood Music School at 203-624-5189, or listen to WELI 960AM.

Or at least romantic music. It's a free quartet concert with NHCer pianist Alexis, titled "Conversation Among Equals: Romantic Chamber Works". Other professional musicians will play violin, viola, and cello. They'll be performing piano quartets by Schubert, Dvorak and Brahms. It's a lunchtime concert, so BYO lunch if you like. And your own date (she's taken). Barry White CDs optional. This is part of the free "Bach's Lunch" series at New Haven's Neighborhood Music School.

Music starts by 12:10. If you're late, only come in during a break (while audience is clapping). Be sure your cell ringer is off (vibrate-only isn't good enough). It ends around 1pm. If you can't stay until the end just be sure to leave during a break.

It's ok to eat at the concert but please keep it quiet unless it's during applause. Be mindful of crinkly bags/wrappers and big celery stalks.

POST-PARTY: After the performance feel free to say "hi" and simper & fawn over Alexis. There may well be a post-party...Alexis and the other performers will still need to have lunch!

HOST: Alexis, cell 203-747-9203. However, she won't be answering her phone starting an hour before the concert, and obviously not during it.

You can hear Alexis playing some Mozart at her site:
www.myspace.com/alexiszingalepianist

DIRECTIONS: For directions, click here

PARKING: Don't expect to find street parking on Audubon St. (which is a 1-way street). Grove & Whitney have street parking, and there are parking garages in the area (such as on Audubon, also on Grove).

To go to the messageboard thread for this Event, click here
item.name: Fri 2/22 - Romance, with Alexis
